intro: Heliotropium texanum, commonly known as Texas heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as roadsides and disturbed areas.
